intro: Cucubalus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas.
